translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

author.author: None

translation.text: His service is insignificant, but his demands are very great.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: He does not obtain the Mansion of the Lord's Presence, but he says that he has arrived there||1||

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਜੋ ਪ੍ਰਿਅ ਮਾਨੇ ਤਿਨ ਕੀ ਰੀਸਾ ॥

translation.text: He competes with those who have been accepted by the Beloved Lord.

transliteration.text: jō pri mānē tin kī rīsā .

translation.text: This is how stubborn the false fool is! ||1||Pause||

text: ਮਨਿ ਨਹੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਕਹੈ ਮੁਖਿ ਰਾਤਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: There is no love in his mind, and yet he says that he is imbued with the Lord. ||3||

transliteration.text: man nahī prīt kahai mukh rātā .3.

text: ਤੁਮ੍ਹ ਸੁਖਦਾਤੇ ਪੁਰਖ ਸੁਭਾਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ਦੂਜਾ ॥੧॥੭॥

translation.text: You are the Giver of Peace, the Loving Primal Being. ||1||Second Pause||1||7||

transliteration.text: tumh sukhadātē purakh subhāī .1. rahāu dūjā .1.7.
